title: Kayhan updates Pathfinder spaceflight safety platform
summary: Spaceflight safety startup Kayhan Space is broadening its product line to address collision threats for launch vehicles and satellites with or without propulsion.

title: FCC considers new rules for emerging space capabilities
summary: An inquiry into updating rules around space debris and emerging on-orbit services seeks to position the U.S. as a leader in an emerging space economy.

title: Download your Thursday ‘News from the 2022 Small Satellite show’ digital edition
summary: The SpaceNews editorial team is producing a daily for the 2022 Small Satellite show, a nightly email newsletter and all-day web coverage during the 2022 Small Satellite show in Logan, Utah the week of August 9.

title: Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter discovers thermally stable areas in surface pits suitable for future lunar bases
summary: Using data from NASA’s Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter (LRO), a group of NASA-funded researchers has discovered that shaded locations inside surface pits on the lunar surface harbor comfortable temperatures that could prove useful for future lunar exploration.

title: Spaceflight’s chemically powered space tug heads for launch
summary: Spaceflight shipped its Sherpa-LTC2 orbital transfer vehicle (OTV) Aug. 10 to Cape Canaveral in Florida, where it will make a second attempt to debut the chemically powered space tug on a SpaceX launch.

title: Astro Digital Q&A: Taking smallsats to the mainstream
summary: Astro Digital started out in 2015 with plans for an Earth observation constellation but pivoted three years later to instead provide its small satellite technology as a service for other operators.

title: SpaceX fires up Starship and Super Heavy booster hours apart
summary: SpaceX appears to have successfully fired up a Starship and Super Heavy booster hours apart, testing a total of three new Raptor...

title: Canada’s MDA eyes UK expansion
summary: Canada’s MDA sees a growing opportunity to expand its international space business from the United Kingdom, where it plans to double its team to 80 employees in the next 12 months.

title: Lockheed Martin’s venture fund to increase investments in space companies
summary: Lockheed Martin Ventures is increasing investments by $200 million and much of that will be focused on the space domain

title: Orbital Insight and Asterra join forces to monitor infrastructure
summary: Orbital Insight announced plans Aug. 9 to work with Israeli startup Asterra to jointly provide remote sensing analytics to water utilities, infrastructure organizations and other industries.
